UnifyingAPI
Class UniElementDescriptor

java.lang.Object
  UnifyingAPI.UniElementDescriptor

public class UniElementDescriptor
extends java.lang.Object

A tuple element descriptor. Describes the type of a single element ina tuple.

Author:
Greg Clark

Constructor Summary
UniElementDescriptor(boolean signed, boolean integer, boolean sizeUnitBytes, byte size)
          Construct a tuple element descriptor with the given characteristics
UniElementDescriptor(byte descriptor)
          Construct a tuple element descriptor from a byte.
 
Method Summary
 byte getDescriptor()
          Retrieves the tuple element descriptor as written in a channel packet header.
 byte getSize()
          Retrieves the size of the corresponding element.
 boolean isInteger()
          Tells whether the corresponding element is an integral type.
 boolean isSigned()
          Tells whether the corresponding element is signed
 boolean isSizedInBytes()
          Tells whether the elements size is given in bytes or bits

Constructor Detail

UniElementDescriptor

public UniElementDescriptor(boolean signed,
                            boolean integer,
                            boolean sizeUnitBytes,
                            byte size)
Construct a tuple element descriptor with the given characteristics

Parameters:
signed - true if and only if the element is a signed type
integer - true if the element is an integral type
sizeUnitBytes - true if the given size is in bytes, false if the size is in bits
size - the size of the element, in either byte or bits as specified by the sizeUnitBytes parameter

UniElementDescriptor

public UniElementDescriptor(byte descriptor)
Construct a tuple element descriptor from a byte.

Parameters:
descriptor - the byte representing a tuple element descriptor from a channel packet header.
Method Detail

isSigned

public boolean isSigned()
Tells whether the corresponding element is signed

Returns:
true if and only if the element is a signed type

isInteger

public boolean isInteger()
Tells whether the corresponding element is an integral type.

Returns:
true if and only if the element is an integral type

isSizedInBytes

public boolean isSizedInBytes()
Tells whether the elements size is given in bytes or bits

Returns:
true if the elements given size is in bytes

getSize

public byte getSize()
Retrieves the size of the corresponding element.

Returns:
the size of the corresponding element. The unit is determined from isSizedInBytes()

getDescriptor

public byte getDescriptor()
Retrieves the tuple element descriptor as written in a channel packet header.

Returns:
the tuple element descriptor as a byte
